edu.concordia.app.model

Class NormalGamePlay

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.concordia.app.model.PlayGame
      • edu.concordia.app.model.NormalGamePlay
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class NormalGamePlay
extends PlayGame
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class creates an instance for the strategy where the game will end as it did in Build 2 (i.e., exactly as described in the rule book).
    Author:
    Team E
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • filterExcessLanternCards

        public java.lang.String filterExcessLanternCards(GameInstance gameObj,
                                                 Players playing,
                                                 java.lang.String opt)
        This method will discard the excess Lantern cards, if the current player has more than 12 lantern cards. The player has two options, either to discard the lantern cards of his choice or to perform either of the three possible dedications.
        Parameters:
        gameObj - The GameInstance object for updating game elements according to user choice.
        playing - The current player of the game.
        opt - The string contain options that player can choose (Dedication/discard).
        Returns:
        The string contain those choices that are not used by the user.

      • gameLastTurnWithoutLakeTiles

        public Players[] gameLastTurnWithoutLakeTiles(GameInstance gameObj)
        The method to take last turn after all lake tiles has been placed on the game board. The players can exchange lantern cards and do the dedication, if they have enough lantern cards and dedication tokens.
        Parameters:
        gameObj - The GameInstance object for updating game elements according to user choice.
        Returns:
        The array of players with updated values according to their last turn.

      • genValidation

        public java.lang.String genValidation(GameInstance gameObj,
                                      Players playing)
        The method to validate the options(exchange/make a dedication) user can choose during the game.
        Parameters:
        gameObj - The GameInstance to verify if exchange or is possible or not.
        playing - The player to verify if exchange or is possible or not.
        Returns:
        The string containing the possible options.

      • saveAndExitGame

        public void saveAndExitGame(GameController gameController)
        The method to save and exit the game according to the user choice.
        Parameters:
        gameController - The GameController object to store the game state to an XML file.

      • rotateLakeTileOnUserChoice

        public LakeTiles rotateLakeTileOnUserChoice(LakeTiles tileInHand)
        This method asks takes input from user and rotate the selected tile to 0/90/180/270 degree.
        Parameters:
        tileInHand - The tile to be rotated before placing on the board.
        Returns:
        The rotated lake tile.

      • updateCurrentPlayer

        public Players updateCurrentPlayer(GameInstance gameObj,
                                   Players playing)
        The method to switch turn to the next player of the game in clockwise direction.
        Parameters:
        playing - The current player of the game.
        gameObj - The GameInstance to retrieve players of the game.

      • revealLakeTile

        public LakeTiles revealLakeTile(Players playing)
        The method to ask player to select one lake tile from three lake tiles in hand and return the selected lake tile.
        Overrides:
        revealLakeTile in class PlayGame
        Parameters:

        Returns:
